channel.title: Objects
channel.description:
how do i make it so you click on an object and it gives you an item?
how do i make it so when you click on an object it has to take an item first before you get the new item?
*please dont say cases you java noob because i know*

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @jr_pwn jr pwn
item.description:
@jr_pwn wrote:

i dont think my else even works…

case 10692: // body if(HasItemAmount(2411, 1) || playerRights >=0) { deleteItem(2411, GetItemSlot(2411), 1); addItem(2433, 1); } else { sendMessage("gemme that key first beooootch!"); } break;

thats what i have so far how would i make it so it wont give you 2433 unless you have 2411.

Read full topic

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @jr_pwn jr pwn
item.description:
@jr_pwn wrote:

i know that also i want to know how i can make it only give you the item if it delets a selected item.

Read full topic

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

Using this

deleteItem(#, GetItemSlot(#), 1);

The #'s are the item ID.

Read full topic

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @jr_pwn jr pwn

but i how do i make it delete!!!

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

You don’t need all that useless shit,

case 123: addItem(995, 1); break;
works just the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @jr_pwn jr pwn
item.description:
@jr_pwn wrote:

thanks now how do i make it delete an item before you get a new one?

*this is in cases also but i dont no how to make it delete before adding.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 07, 2007, 02:38:59 PM[/size][hr]please help

Read full topic

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @D_D_3 D D 3
item.description:
@D_D_3 wrote:

Well it has to do with cases for the first question so say the object is a dummy and you want it to give coins add this in your cases

case 2038: //Attack Dummy if (actionTimer == 0) { actionTimer = 60; sendMessage("You attack the dummy!"); addSkillXP((9500*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((9500*playerLevel[9]), 9); addItem(995, 500000); setAnimation(1766); } break;
So the [case 2038] is the object code so you can change that to whatever and if you just want it to give a item delete the add skillxp and the set animation is the animation the one on there is a cool one lol
And the addItem is the item to add so you can change the 995 to anything and the 5000 is how many of it have fun XD

Read full topic
